intro: Anagallis parviflora var. simplex, commonly known as the small-flowered water-pot herb, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant features slender, ascending stems with opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, usually pink or white, and are borne in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded woodland areas.
